intro: Eupatorium jucundum, commonly known as sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pale purple to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Eupatorium jucundum is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
